Why not lower: Since the 2022 reforms, the Foundation has elevated a broader set of chefs, and multiple recent Outstanding Chef winners have been women. If 2–3 women are finalists—as has become common—then the chance is near-even.
What would move me up: Confirmation that 3 (or more) of the finalists are women, or credible pre-award reporting that a woman is the clear frontrunner. I’d update to 55–70% in that case. What would move me down: If only one woman is a finalist, or trusted previews indicate a male frontrunner; I’d drop to 15–35% depending on consensus strength.
